Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<Update>
it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<java.lang.Object>
public class Controller
extends Observable<Update>
implements Observer<java.lang.Object>
This class represents Client's Controller in MVC design pattern. In particular, this controller has the task of doing some "internal" control of objects, in order to perform a pre-process of commands that are going to be sent to server; the main control is verifying that client has the "right" to send a command, so if it is its turn or not. Obviously, according to MVC design pattern, "real" and complete Controller is server-side; however, this one performs some simple controls to avoid sending clearly wrong commands through socket (so, its main task is to enlighten network communication when possible). Remember that all controls done here must be repeated server-side too.

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Player getClientPlayer()
    This method is the getter for Player-object representing the "human" player who is playing from this client.

    The method returns the unique client ID given by server to a player.

    The method is the getter for current player's unique ID; current player is the player who is playing his/her turn.

    The method is the getter for current player's nickname; current player is the player who is playing his/her turn.

    • isClientPlayerGodChooser

      public boolean isClientPlayerGodChooser()
      This method tells if player associated with this client is match god-chooser or not.
      Returns:
      true if client-player is god-chooser for the match; false if he/she is not god-chooser

    • setClientPlayerNickname

      The method is the setter for player nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname to set

    • update

      public void update​(java.lang.Object message)
      This method is an overriding method of "update" in Observer interface. Its task is to handle specific Commands, verifying that they are sent by current-player. The method also updates current-player and all Strings related to it (nickname, ID) on the basis of a specific Update received by Server (TurnUpdate).
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<java.lang.Object>
      Parameters:
      message - object to be controlled client-side
